intro: Guatteria rhamnoides, commonly known as the Mexican huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to Central America and northern South America, where it typically grows in humid, tropical lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that contains several seeds, and it is often used in traditional medicine. Guatteria rhamnoides plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing food for various wildlife species.
